empty_state.title: Configure a New Certificate
empty_state.description: Certificates handle SSL/TLS termination for encrypted requests.

empty_state_v2.title: Configure your first certificate
empty_state_v2.group: Certificates created in gateways within this group will automatically appear here.
empty_state_v2.description: Certificates manage SSL/TLS encryption, ensuring secure communication between clients and your API services.

ssl.title: SSL Key Pair
ssl.description: The PEM-encoded public certificate chain and private key of the SSL key pair and the alternate.

general.title: General Information
general.description: General information will help identify and manage this key.

cert.label: Cert
cert.tooltip: PEM-encoded public certificate chain of the SSL key pair. This field is {emphasis}, which means it can be securely stored as a secret in a vault. References must follow a specific format.

key.label: Key
key.tooltip: PEM-encoded private key of the SSL key pair. This field is {emphasis}, which means it can be securely stored as a secret in a vault. References must follow a specific format.

cert_alt.label: Cert Alt
cert_alt.tooltip: PEM-encoded public certificate chain of the alternate SSL key pair. This should only be set if you have both RSA and ECDSA types of certificate available and would like Kong to prefer serving using ECDSA certs when client advertises support for it. This field is {emphasis}, which means it can be securely stored as a secret in a vault. References must follow a specific format.

key_alt.label: Key Alt
key_alt.tooltip: PEM-encoded private key of the alternate SSL key pair. This should only be set if you have both RSA and ECDSA types of certificate available and would like Kong to prefer serving using ECDSA certs when client advertises support for it. This field is {emphasis}, which means it can be securely stored as a secret in a vault. References must follow a specific format.

snis.label: SNIs
snis.tooltip: Zero or more hostnames to associate with this certificate as SNIs
snis.editingTip: To manage SNIs for this certificate, click {link}.

tags.label: Tags
tags.placeholder: Enter a list of tags separated by comma
tags.tooltip: An optional set of strings for grouping and filtering, separated by commas.

delete.title: Delete a Certificate
delete.description2: This action cannot be reversed so make sure to check the certificate usage before deleting.

errors.delete: The certificate could not be deleted at this time

empty_state.title: Configure a New CA Certificate
empty_state.description: CA certificates validate client or server certificates.

empty_state_v2.title: Configure your first CA certificate
empty_state_v2.group: CA Certificates created in gateways within this group will automatically appear here.
empty_state_v2.description: CA Certificates validate the authenticity of client and server certificates, reinforcing the trust and security of your API communications.

cert.title: Public Certificate
cert.description: The PEM-encoded public certificate of the CA and itâ€™s SHA256 hex digest.

general.title: General Information
general.description: General information will help identify and manage this key.

cert.label: Cert
cert.tooltip: PEM-encoded public certificate of the CA.

cert_digest.label: Cert Digest
cert_digest.tooltip: SHA256 hex digest of the public certificate

tags.label: Tags
tags.placeholder: Enter a list of tags separated by comma
tags.tooltip: An optional set of strings for grouping and filtering, separated by commas.

delete.title: Delete a CA Certificate
delete.description2: This action cannot be reversed so make sure to check the certificate usage before deleting.

errors.general: CA Certificates could not be retrieved
errors.delete: The CA Certificate could not be deleted at this time
